column1: So many small business owners workers & entrepreneurs have reimagined the job in order to continue serving our communities through this #COVID19 crisis.  Each of us should do our part to support our incredible local businesses this holiday season.  https://t.co/jVxePgqYWZ

With jobless claims again on the rise Congress must act now to deliver families the #COVID19 support they need.  Our #HeroesAct gets it done with additional $600 weekly unemployment benefits to provide a lifeline to those fighting to weather this storm.  https://t.co/6ZgZk8PFDv

Our Capital Region & nation continue to see chilling increases in #COVID19 cases and deaths. We must not let our guard down. We can each do our part to protect our hometown communities. Read more in my latest newsletter below:  https://t.co/leh8GuqUO9

In the past week we've seen over 1.1 million new #COVID19 cases. In my latest newsletter I reflect on the threat this presents to our communities & our dire need for a real federal response. The only way out of this crisis is pushing through it together.  https://t.co/leh8GuqUO9

We can take heart in the remarkable work of researchers to deliver promising #COVID19 vaccines.  Until they are widely available the most effective protection we have is social distancing & wearing a mask around others.  Each of us should do our part to protect our communities.

Our work to build our economy back better starts with a federal #COVID19 rescue that supports families & small businesses devastated by this crisis. They need a lifeline and we need to deliver national investments in testing tracing and treatment. We need the #HeroesAct.

As our nation reaches scary new heights in this #COVID19 crisis it is more important than ever that we come together to coordinate a national plan. In my latest newsletter I highlight how that unity first requires a peaceful transition of power:  https://t.co/occqsRrx7N

ATTENTION NEW YORKERS!! Open enrollment has begun! Learn about the available NY State of Health insurance plans in your county in the link below.  As we continue to face this #COVID19 pandemic it is vital that Americans #GetCovered!  https://t.co/3TJIszQbf8

I sent a letter today to @WHOSTP to demand answers on its failure to uphold scientific integrity and call for immediate action to ensure these standards are protected to prevent further deadly harm to our nation from #COVID19. https://t.co/STQdRTmMmr

My latest newsletter shows how our $2 trillion CARES Act passed in March delivered vital support to the American people. With #COVID19 cases again on the rise it's more clear than ever that we need another rescue for families workers & small businesses.  https://t.co/dexsRFjm4A

#COVID19 cases across the nation are once again on the rise.   Rather than acting immediately to support American families in the midst of this crisis the Senate continues to drag its feet.   Our communities need a rescue. We need the #HeroesAct.

3 weeks ago the House passed the updated #HeroesAct to help Americans get back on their feet by:  - Funding testing tracing & treatment - Sending another round of stimulus checks - Restoring $600/week expanded unemployment  It's past time the Senate pass this #COVID19 rescue.

#COVID19 has impacted communities of color at an alarming rate and shown the clear inequities of our public health system and now @EPA is gutting regulations that are meant to #ProtectCleanWater and keep families healthy. These dangerous cuts must end. #CWA48

With each passing week that the Senate fails to advance a #COVID19 rescue more Americans are forced to file for unemployment. I urge Senate Republicans to at last come to the negotiating table to pass a plan that truly delivers for those who need it most. https://t.co/hdoVguEpMn

Millions of Americans have fallen into poverty through no fault of their own.   The House passed multiple #COVID19 rescue plans. Meanwhile Republicans are racing to confirm Trump’s Supreme Court nominee. The Senate has a duty to serve not play politics.  https://t.co/eW6DmlDF19

While the Senate has walked away from delivering needed relief for the American people I have not stopped fighting alongside my colleagues to advance a #COVID19 rescue. Countless families workers & businesses depend on federal support to weather this storm. We must not fail.

Had the pleasure of speaking with my friends from @CapRegionBOCES today. As always they imparted helpful insights including how schools across our region have adjusted operations in the wake of #COVID19 and the serious need for federal funding for education. https://t.co/XfrCb6p7G8

The updated #HeroesAct makes critical additions to address needs that have arisen since the House first acted & maintains key priorities from our original bill.    The House has taken action—now the Senate must at long last advance a COVID-19 rescue for the American people.

Efficiency employs more Americans than any other single energy sector but more than 400000 jobs have been lost in this field due to the #COVID19 crisis. We need to make smart investments in #EnergyEfficiency to save money cut pollution & create jobs! #EEDay2020

The House has passed two versions of the #HeroesAct to deliver urgently-needed #COVID19 rescue. Republicans must stop playing politics & enact the updated Heroes Act immediately or come forth with their own plan that delivers for American families.

The past several months have shown how crucial our manufacturers are in addressing the #COVID19 pandemic and helping strengthen our economy. Thank you to the makers of PPE medical equipment and everyone with homemade masks! 👏#MFGDay20

The manufacturing industry is the backbone of our American economy. Glad to join with a number of Capital Region manufacturers for #MFGDay20 to discuss the challenges they're facing with COVID-19 and develop solutions to help the industry thrive today & in the future. https://t.co/Eup8ZFYQKl

I’m troubled by news this morning that the President & First Lady have tested positive for COVID-19—a stark reminder of how easily this virus can be spread. I’m keeping them and all who are struggling with this disease in my thoughts and hope they make a swift & complete recovery

Our updated COVID-19 rescue delivers:  $225B in education funding $436B in state & local assistance $75B for COVID-19 testing & tracing $15B in funding for @USPS & much more  It's long past time the Senate work with @HouseDemocrats to provide the support Americans need.

In the four months since the House passed the Heroes Act more than 110000 Americans have died of COVID-19.  This is the equivalent of losing every soul living in Albany New York. We have reached the breaking point plain and simple.

We’ve been fighting for months to advance a COVID-19 rescue for our Capital Region & beyond. Senate Republicans won’t take up our bill and they won’t offer an alternative that is up to the job.  Now our nation has passed the terrifying milestone of 200000 deaths. 1/ https://t.co/ji6chrp7gZ

Our nation is rapidly approaching the painful milestone of 200000 deaths caused by COVID-19. We need a national rescue plan with robust testing tracing and treatment to protect our communities. America needs the Heroes Act. https://t.co/0HIcoOM4Gl

More schools are closing every day due to the threat of COVID-19. We need a rescue plan that will deliver critical funds to prevent devastating budget cuts and job losses. We need the Senate to take up our House-passed Heroes Act now and get the job done.

More than 100 days ago #HouseDemocrats delivered a COVID-19 rescue plan to save our nation called the Heroes Act. It’s long past time for the Senate do its job and pass legislation that can get the job done for our communities and economy.

A strong national framework for COVID-19 testing tracing and treatment has been sitting on Mitch McConnell’s desk for more than 100 days. Enough is enough. The Senate must stop obstructing our work to rescue our economy & loved ones!

@USPS Many of you have relied on @USPS to deliver prescription medicine or other medical supplies e.g. bandages and over-the-counter painkillers.   Not only have our friends at USPS helped keep our medicine cabinets stocked and first aid kits ready they've let us stay safe from COVID.

#ICYMI: my latest newsletter was on improving our national COVID-19 response.  Now 13 weeks & counting the Senate must not delay action any longer. Vote now to pass our rescue plan "the Heroes Act" to save our country millions of jobs & countless lives. https://t.co/TfILYfveVt

COVID-19 has only worsened the U.S. opioid epidemic. Those among us living with substance use disorder need our help more than ever.  Congress must advance my Mainstreaming Addiction Treatment (MAT) Act to expand access to treatment & save countless lives. https://t.co/59ESiDgryK

I wrote the COVID-19 Mental Health Research Act and made sure it was advanced in the House-passed Heroes Act to ensure this vital bill addresses not only the physical but also the mental health consequences of COVID-19. The Senate needs to vote! https://t.co/rgE49bSJUR

More than 2 months after we passed the Heroes Act the Senate has released a half-baked COVID-19 response that fails to meet the basic needs of our communities or the urgency of this moment. Americans need a real rescue plan. The Heroes Act—advanced in the House in May—delivers. https://t.co/XpNUSqvQGo

We passed #HeroesAct in May. Senate had 2 months to respond. In that time 60000 Americans have died of COVID-19. Millions have lost jobs. Local communities are on the brink & facing whether to lay off teachers or firefighters first.  #HeroesAct is the rescue plan America needs. https://t.co/YLwnWdw8Ho

Basic medical supplies such as vials & syringes will be critical to running a successful COVID-19 vaccine program. Thanks @MenePangalos @John_Young & Dr. Stephen Hoge for their work ensuring adequate supply for providers & supporting efforts to develop a safe effective vaccine. https://t.co/gPdxK0WC8d

ICE's visa ruling to force international students who take entirely online courses out of the U.S. not only harms their education it impedes universities & colleges from effectively addressing #COVID19 and threatens the health of all students & faculty. https://t.co/q05Yr0qTP0

West Glenville Fire District #6 will receive $2300 COVID-19 federal funding for PPE. Our firefighters put their lives on the line to keep us safe. We need to ensure they have the tools they need to protect themselves while they fight to protect all of us. https://t.co/OgCB0rECLH

Telemedicine has been a valuable tool in this pandemic but it’s too often limited by poor internet service. Congratulations @EllisMedicine for earning $131261 from @FCC to cover remote diagnosis monitoring & other equipment to treat COVID-19 patients! https://t.co/p0E9lnOpNI

If you participated in protests over the last few days & believe you may have been exposed to #COVID19 FREE WALK-UP TESTING IS AVAILABLE TODAY at Capital South Campus 20 Warren Street in Albany.  Take care of yourself & help keep our community safe. Get tested for free today. https://t.co/nuxKHfp0cm

With more than 100000 Americans already lost to COVID-19 it's more vital than ever that we move forward with a sound course of action. The Heroes Act does just that ensuring our workers families & communities have the tools needed to face this crisis.  https://t.co/oGQHVMz1W6

Thank you to our expert panel & all who tuned in last night for our Coronavirus telephone town hall. As we continue our pandemic response it is vital we are guided by science in order to save lives and lead our nation to a strong economic recovery.  1/2 https://t.co/lu3UoWV9nz

HAPPENING NOW: I'm hosting a Coronavirus Telephone Town Hall with constituents and will be joined by local health education & economic development leaders across our Capital Region.   Follow the link to listen to the conversation on pandemic response.  https://t.co/3yD7lpde4d

HAPPENING SOON: I am hosting a telephone town hall tonight with local health education & economic development experts to provide information and updates on our #COVID19 response.  Follow the link below to tune into the conversation starting at 6:50PM:  https://t.co/3yD7lpde4d

TONIGHT: I will be hosting a telephone town hall this evening Wednesday May 27th at 6:50PM with constituents and will be joined by local health education and economic development experts to provide an update on #COVID19.  1/2

🚨🚨APPLICATIONS OPEN🚨🚨 @USDA is accepting applications for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program. Glad to see this vital support for our farmers—who are the backbone of our nation's economy. I will continue fighting so that they have the tools needed to weather this storm. https://t.co/JEUcc97uD8

🚨🚨ATTENTION🚨🚨 Beginning May 26th @USDA will be accepting applications for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program. Glad to see our nation's farmers—who are the backbone of our economy—will at last be provided desperately needed funds to help weather this storm. https://t.co/7bd1toEUrc

Nursing home worker Dorothy Collins said: "We're scared for our residents and ourselves & our families. We don’t want to go home & infect our loved ones. The fact that this is a pandemic means that COVID-19 doesn’t only impact our nursing home—it affects our entire community." https://t.co/84QJa7EOJi

Robert Mengel head of one of our local firefighter advocacy orgs told me: “The women and men of the Albany Fire Department are front and center in the fight against #COVID19. We collectively answer the call each time an alarm rings—and we need Congress to respond to our alarm."

- Support for small businesses by strengthening the Payroll Protection Program to (1) make sure it can reach underserved communities & diverse nonprofits and (2) is flexible by providing $10 billion for COVID-19 emergency grants through the Economic Injury Disaster Loan program.

- An additional $75 billion for the testing tracing and treatment we need in order to have a science-based path to safely reopen our country and helping ensure that every American can access free #coronavirus treatment.

Today I announced big news: The Heroes Act—new COVID-19 crisis relief legislation just introduced in the House—provides more than $1.3 billion in crisis-response aid to New York’s Capital Region and a much-needed $49.5 billion to New York State overall.   1/

There are hundreds of thousands of Americans who are ready to roll up their sleeves and get to work helping our communities recover. I support the plan in Congress to expand national service to respond to #COVID19. #Stand4Service https://t.co/UoMN0sg9yZ

May begins Mental Health Awareness Month which is more important now than ever before.  COVID-19 attacks our minds as well as our bodies. If you are feeling down be open reach out and connect to people. Although we’re physically alone we are truly together in this fight.

Inspiring to see the brilliant minds in our Capital Region developing innovative solutions to combat #COVID19.  We must continue to expand our testing and contact tracing capabilities and be guided by science for our nation to overcome this crisis. https://t.co/KwrphqGpFz

As our frontline workers fight to protect us Congress must return the favor and ensure they are compensated fairly.  Our letter calls for the next #COVID19 funding package to fully support our health care workers who have sacrificed so much during this pandemic. https://t.co/OfKMtKGEWs

The #COVID19 pandemic has exacerbated the challenges our communities face with a lack of broadband access. Proud to lead in this vital effort to improve broadband resources that our students teachers workers and emergency responders depend on.  1/2  https://t.co/ukoQi2kuBb

Our health care providers are enduring physical AND mental stress by this crisis. While they help the rest of us we can help them too. That’s why I introduced legislation to research mental health stress and impacts on health care workers during #COVID19. https://t.co/rgE49bSJUR

Our public transit systems are a vital service for our communities & we fought hard to include them in our #COVID19 response. Proud $42.7M has been awarded to @CDTA enabling them to continue to serve our Capital Region & protect their workers and riders. https://t.co/uoLoo93qqr
Tune in as I join my upstate New York colleagues at 7:00 PM tonight in a bipartisan town hall discussion on the COVID-19 pandemic.  https://t.co/84YT6S4mvX

Today I spoke with our Capital Region 1199SEIU members to provide an update on our federal response to #COVID19 receive feedback and hear firsthand accounts from our incredible health care professionals fighting to keep us safe. https://t.co/lEolZoqtsa

SSA and RRB recipients who did not file a tax return in 2018 or 2019 & have dependents; Treasury requires action by TOMORROW April 22 in order to add the $500 per eligible child amount to COVID-19 payments.  https://t.co/kvdmzhZHbo Visit https://t.co/pJLBYr6eIa for more details.

Couldn’t agree more with @RepHaleyStevens on the need to move the Scientific Integrity Act in our #COVID19 response. Proud to serve with Chair Stevens in promoting research and facts to keep us safe! #sciencematters #ScientificIntegrityAct  https://t.co/yuSbUoeoLG

Many of our businesses and families depend on the services that @USPS employees have continued to provide throughout this pandemic.  I joined 121 of my colleagues to urge that our next #COVID19 response package helps ensure the lasting health of this vital agency. https://t.co/u9Cj1mUihE

Disturbing that the Administration is trying to uproot environmental protections during #COVID19 hoping no one will notice. We noticed and we strongly condemn these actions that obstruct the public’s basic right to participate in the rulemaking process. https://t.co/dNiXTiLZ7y

ATTENTION: The SBA is hiring temporary employees in response to the #COVID19 pandemic.   Visit their website for details on positions which include program support document preparation loan processing customer service representative and more. https://t.co/n0Fghe36u1

I have heard from dairy farmers across our Capital Region impacted by the #COVID19 crisis & in need of immediate relief.   That's why my colleagues & I sent a letter urging the USDA to ensure the industry which is vital to our rural communities receives the assistance it needs. https://t.co/SDsUmHBQ9r

Despite this EPA chooses to undermine science—letting politicians rank studies and throw away the ones they don’t like. I testified during @UCSUSA’s public hearing today because science is our best defense to protect our communities against #COVID19.  2/2 https://t.co/hnljpO9yH5

Our trade workers are supporting our communities each and every day by improving the capacity of health centers and developing our nation’s infrastructure.   I stand with @GoIUPAT and @DC9_IUPAT and agree that our fourth #COVID19 relief package must put #WorkersFirst.

This #WorldHealthDay and every day we recognize and celebrate our healthcare heroes around the globe working on the frontlines to protect our communities and fight the #COVID19 pandemic. Your contributions inspire us all and for your tireless efforts we say THANK YOU. https://t.co/6DOBXrEmjU

Small businesses need immediate relief to address the #COVID19 pandemic.   That’s why I led a letter with my colleagues calling on big banks to provide better customer service to businesses applying for PPP loans and partner with smaller banks and lending-institutions. https://t.co/zbAsF3kMHr
Please check out my webpage at https://t.co/4rw1UGHNuw or contact my office to find resources available to local nonprofits responding to the #COVID19 pandemic. 2/2

NONPROFITS: Tuesday April 7 at 3PM the National Council of Nonprofits will host a FREE webinar offering information on provisions of the #CARESAct and #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act and what they mean for your organizations.  Register below: https://t.co/vHRyJ9XJ2q 1/2

STARTING TODAY: The Capital Region will have a new #COVID19 drive-through testing site on the UAlbany campus.   Individuals who would like to be tested must make an appointment by calling 888-364-3065. https://t.co/lHCJbp0Dy0

Companies can email Covid19supplies@esd.ny.gov or call 212-803-3100 to help alleviate this shortage and receive state funding.  Your vital efforts will protect our frontline medical professionals and save countless Americans.

Many incredible companies in our Capital Region are working around the clock to manufacture critically needed supplies to fight the #COVID19 pandemic—but New York is in desperate need of more. https://t.co/gnmpF9J6IP

The #CARESAct took vital steps to tackle #COVID19 but we must keep working to ensure our small communities do not miss out on needed resources & funding.  That’s why I joined 120+ bipartisan members in a letter to make sure no American is left behind because of where they live. https://t.co/iE1uAoHQ7y
HAPPENING NOW: I am hosting a Coronavirus Telephone Town Hall with local health and economic experts on #COVID19.  Follow the link below to listen to the conversation!  https://t.co/3yD7lpde4d

HAPPENING SOON: I am hosting a Coronavirus Telephone Town Hall with local health and economic development experts as we provide information and updates about #COVID19.  Follow the link below to tune into the conversation!  https://t.co/3yD7lpde4d

TODAY: I will be hosting a telephone town hall this evening Wednesday April 1st at 6:10PM with local health and economic development experts to provide an update on #COVID19.  1/2 https://t.co/RnOcXU80B5

Day in and day out America’s health care workers are fighting #coronavirus. I voted YES for the bipartisan #CARESAct to provide them with the resources they need to succeed and protect themselves and our communities. https://t.co/RP0ZKXesHW

ICYMI: My latest newsletter breaks down the ways the #CARESAct supports American families workers & small businesses. See how this package helps communities fight the #coronavirus & sign up for my newsletter to get more updates at https://t.co/1bP2syDl3F  https://t.co/BeZQxpRlwZ

The historic House passage of the Coronavirus Aid Relief and Economic Security (CARES) Act will provide Americans with the resources they need and ease the incredible burden they face fighting this public health crisis. #CARESAct https://t.co/oy8BJDCWWM

We cannot fight #COVID19—or any crisis—without science.  Yet that's exactly what EPA intends to do by ignoring scientific & medical studies with conclusions they don’t like. If public health experts & scientists are sidelined we all will pay the price. https://t.co/BI9ScJl0Hc

As the #coronavirus outbreak grows so too does our critical need for ventilators. I joined my NY colleagues in bipartisan fashion calling on @HHSgov to provide 20000 ventilators to save countless and enable our state to tackle this public health crisis. https://t.co/IyZ1VWz8AN

I am leading the effort in Congress to make sure the mental scars from this national nightmare can be healed.   America needs a mental health wake-up and I intend to help provide it after COVID-19. https://t.co/iTrTeKOyYe  https://t.co/yXflFiB2OL

Health care workers & hospitals across the U.S. need ventilators PPE & other essential supplies to address the #coronavirus.  That’s why I cosponsored this resolution supporting the urgent use of the Defense Production Act (DPA) to protect American lives. https://t.co/Jc7ChXKtK4

Small businesses in New York affected by the coronavirus outbreak can now apply for the SBA Economic Injury Disaster Loan (EIDL) online as https://t.co/QR1H6yfwt5  Our office is here to assist with benefits or applying for SBA loan. https://t.co/ouM8av97En

Ensuring healthcare workers have access to N95 respirators is essential in tackling the #coronavirus outbreak & saving lives. That's why I authored a provision to guarantee adequate supply of masks. It’s now law c/o #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act. https://t.co/NkUlaWmJkN

In this time of fear and uncertainty it is essential we safeguard not only the physical but also the mental health of Americans. Glad to lead my colleagues today calling on Congress to address mental health services in our #coronavirus response.  https://t.co/iTrTeKOyYe
I urge everyone to remain informed and follow the recommendations of CDC in order to stop the spread of #coronavirus. https://t.co/XlNNMchkc2
Below are the President’s #coronavirus guidelines for Americans. https://t.co/zbjtH12ZP6

I voted to pass the #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act to guarantee free testing to protect public health & provide paid leave to alleviate the devastating consequences of lost wages. Americans need this whole of government response to #coronavirus.  https://t.co/5xW5wsQydh

We must confront #coronavirus with every tool at our disposal. @HouseDemocrats’ #FamiliesFirst legislation would provide:  -Free coronavirus testing -Paid emergency leave -Enhanced food security  Congress must pass the #FamiliesFirst Act!   https://t.co/NEO5gwlCYm
Thank you to @FrankPallone for working together on this issue and your steadfast leadership in crafting a response to the COVID-19 outbreak that puts our families and frontline responders first.

Ensuring adequate supply of personal protective equipment such as N95 respirators is critical to protect front line healthcare workers during the coronavirus outbreak. Glad my bill that does just that is included in latest coronavirus relief package. https://t.co/68Ye7Szfdk
